SEARCH
Package com.brunomnsilva.smartgraph.graphview

Class SmartGraphPanel<V,E>

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
com.brunomnsilva.smartgraph.graphview.SmartGraphPanel<V,E>
Type Parameters:
V - Type of element stored at a vertex
E - Type of element stored at an edge
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class SmartGraphPanel<V,E> extends javafx.scene.layout.Pane
JavaFX Pane that is capable of plotting a Graph or Digraph.
Be sure to call init(javafx.scene.layout.Pane) after the Stage is displayed.
Whenever changes to the underlying graph are made, you should call update() to force the rendering of any new elements and, also, the removal of others, if applicable.
Vertices can be dragged by the user, if configured to do so. Consequently, any connected edges will also adjust automatically to the new vertex positioning.
Author:
brunomnsilva

  • Constructor Details

    • SmartGraphPanel

      public SmartGraphPanel(com.brunomnsilva.smartgraph.graph.Graph<V,E> theGraph, SmartGraphProperties properties, SmartPlacementStrategy placementStrategy, URI cssFile, ForceDirectedLayoutStrategy<V> layoutStrategy)
      Constructs a visualization of the graph referenced by theGraph, using custom parameters.
      This is the only FXML-friendly constructor (there can only be one). If you need to instantiate the default parameters (besides graph), they are the following:
      • properties - new SmartGraphProperties()
      • placementStrategy - new SmartCircularSortedPlacementStrategy()
      • cssFileURI - new File("smartgraph.css").toURI()
      • automaticLayoutStrategy - new ForceDirectedSpringGravityLayoutStrategy()
      Parameters:
      theGraph - underlying graph
      properties - custom properties
      placementStrategy - placement strategy
      cssFile - alternative css file, instead of default 'smartgraph.css'
      layoutStrategy - the automatic layout strategy to use
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments is null

    • SmartGraphPanel

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init(javafx.scene.layout.Pane node) throws IllegalStateException
      Runs the initial current vertex placement strategy.

      This method should only be called once during the lifetime of the object and only after the underlying Scene is displayed.
      Furthermore, required updates should be performed through the update() method.

      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - The exception is thrown if: (1) the Scene is not yet displayed; (2) It has zero width and/or height, and; (3) If this method was already called.

    • automaticLayoutProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty automaticLayoutProperty()
      Returns the property used to toggle the automatic layout of vertices.
      Returns:
      automatic layout property
      See Also:
      • setAutomaticLayout(boolean)

    • setAutomaticLayout

      public void setAutomaticLayout(boolean value)
      Toggle the automatic layout of vertices.
      Parameters:
      value - true if enabling; false, otherwise

      Changes the current automatic layout strategy.
      Parameters:

    • getModel

      public com.brunomnsilva.smartgraph.graph.Graph<V,E> getModel()

      The concrete type of the returned instance may be a Graph or Digraph.
      Returns:
      the underlying model

      Returns:
      a collection of the smart edges

    • update

      public void update()
      Forces a refresh of the visualization based on current state of the underlying graph, immediately returning to the caller.
      This method invokes the refresh in the graphical thread through Platform.runLater(), so its not guaranteed that the visualization is in sync immediately after this method finishes. That is, this method immediately returns to the caller without waiting for the update to the visualization.

      New vertices will be added close to adjacent ones or randomly for isolated vertices.

    • updateAndWait

      public void updateAndWait()
      Forces a refresh of the visualization based on current state of the underlying graph and waits for completion of the update.
      Use this variant only when necessary, e.g., need to style an element immediately after adding it to the underlying graph. Otherwise, use update() instead for performance’s sake.

      New vertices will be added close to adjacent ones or randomly for isolated vertices.

    • setVertexDoubleClickAction

      public void setVertexDoubleClickAction(Consumer<SmartGraphVertex<V>> action)

    • setVertexLabelProvider

      public void setVertexLabelProvider(SmartLabelProvider<V> labelProvider)
      Sets the vertex label provider for this SmartGraphPanel.
      The label provider has priority over any other method of obtaining the same values, such as annotations.
      To remove the provider, call this method with a null argument.
      Parameters:
      labelProvider - the label provider to set

    • setEdgeLabelProvider

      Parameters:
      labelProvider - the label provider to set

    • setVertexPosition

      public void setVertexPosition(com.brunomnsilva.smartgraph.graph.Vertex<V> v, double x, double y)
      Sets a vertex position (its center) manually.
      The positioning should be inside the boundaries of the panel, but no restrictions are enforced by this method, so be aware.
      Parameters:
      v - underlying vertex
      x - x-coordinate on panel
      y - y-coordinate on panel

    • getVertexPositionX

      public double getVertexPositionX(com.brunomnsilva.smartgraph.graph.Vertex<V> v)
      Return the current x-coordinate (relative to the panel) of a vertex.
      Parameters:
      v - underlying vertex
      Returns:
      the x-coordinate or NaN if the vertex does not exist

    • getVertexPositionY
